Package Chess

Class Logic

java.lang.Object
Chess.Logic
public class Logic
extends java.lang.Object
The class Logic contains methods used during a game of chess such as mapping file-rank to array indices, identifying player input, checking for check and checkmate, etc...
Author:
Nicolas Carchio, Adam Romano

    • clearPath

      public static boolean clearPath​(Cell[][] board, int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Determines whether there is a clear path between two cells
      Parameters:
      board - The chess board.
      startX - The x-coordinate of the starting cell.
      startY - The y-coordinate of the starting cell.
      endX - The x-coordinate of the ending cell.
      endY - The y-coordinate of the ending cell.
      Returns:
      True if there is a clear path, false otherwise.

    • getCheckingPath

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getCheckingPath​(Cell[][] board, int startX, int startY, int endX, int endY)
      Returns the list of cells in the path from the piece checking the king to the king itself.
      Parameters:
      board - The chess board.
      startX - The x-coordinate of the king.
      startY - The y-coordinate of the king.
      endX - The x-coordinate of the checking cell.
      endY - The y-coordinate of the checking cell.
      Returns:
      List of cells.
